intro: Hieracium ionthadium, commonly known as the Ionian Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its leaves are usually rough and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium ionthadium is often found in coastal areas and can be an indicator of specific soil conditions.
